==German== {{wikipedia|lang=de}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈmɪtaːk/}} {{a|standard}} ** {{audio|de|De-Mittag.ogg}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈmɪtax/}} {{a|northern Germany and parts of central Germany; now chiefly colloquial}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈmɪtaːx/}} {{a|parts of central Germany; now chiefly colloquial}} * {{hyphenation|de|Mit|tag}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|mittitac}}, compound of ''mitti-'' (see {{m|de|Mitte}}) and ''-tac'' (see {{m|de|Tag}}). Cognate to {{cog|nl|middag}}. ====Noun==== {{de-noun|m||Mittage}} # [[noon]], [[midday]], late [[morning]], early [[afternoon]] {{gloss|time from about 11 a.m. to 2 p.m}} #: ''Sie hat bis '''Mittag''' geschlafen.'' #:: She slept until midday. # {{lb|de|archaic}} [[south]] {{gloss|compass point representing 180°}} #*'''1545''', [[:w:Martin Luther|Martin Luther]], ''Luther Bible'', Exodus 26:18 (with KJV translation) #*: Zwenzig ſollen ir ſtehen gegen dem '''mittag''' #*:: And thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards on the '''south''' side southward. =====Declension===== {{de-decl-noun-m|(e)s|e}} {{Template:list:times of day/de}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|de|Vormittag}} * {{l|de|Nachmittag}} * {{l|de|Mittagsruhe}} * {{l|de|Mittagessen}} * {{l|de|Mittagspause}} * {{l|de|mittags}} =====See also===== * {{l|de|Mitternacht}} * {{l|de|Nacht}} * {{l|de|Tag}} * {{l|de|Abend}} ===Etymology 2=== Shortened from {{m|de|Mittagessen}}. ====Noun==== {{de-noun|n||Mittags}} # {{lb|de|somewhat|informal}} [[lunch]] {{gloss|light meal eaten around midday}} #: ''Wann gibt's '''Mittag'''?'' #:: When is '''lunch''' ready?
